description: The version of this schema

comments: Generates randomness around a point. Seed is where you begin try converging towards. Only required if needed to replicate a run. Does the log push out this value?
description: Seed value for the random number generator in the network
Flag of verbosity
Parameters to configure the dataset

comments: JPG/PNG - auto pick this up
description: Extension of the images to be used.

comments: Can be system generated - after conversion. This is the dataset preparation step.
Where the dataset is - where the images are. Will it figure it out from the parent directory?
Read all labels in the label file (car,truck,suv,person). Ask the user to map it to Vehicle/Person.
description: This parameter maps the class names in the tfrecords to the target class to be trained in the network. An element is defined for every source class to target class mapping. This field was included with the intention of grouping similar class objects under one umbrella. For example: car,van,heavy_truck etc may be grouped under automobile.

comments: Class you want to train for (vehicle)
description: The "key" field is the value of the class name in the tfrecords file.

comments: Class defined in the label file (car,truck,suv -> map to vehicle)
description: The "value" field corresponds to the value that the network is expected to learn.

comments: Default - 0
description: In case of an n fold tfrecords,you define the index of the fold to use for validation. For sequencewise validation choose the validation fold in the range [0,N-1]. For random split partitioning,force the validation fold index to 0 as the tfrecord is just 2-fold.

comments: Dataset specific config - augmentation
description: Collection of parameters to configure the preprocessing and on the fly data augmentation

comments: The resolution at which the network should be trained for. Get the max dimesnion of images in the dataset and set the as the default behind the scenes - has to be multiple of 16.
description: The width of the augmentation output. This is the same as the width of the network input and must be a multiple of 16.

comments: Get the max dimesnion of images in the dataset and set the as the default behind the scenes - has to be multiple of 16
description: The height of the augmentation output. This is the same as the height of the network input and must be a multiple of 16.

comments: Smaller side of image(height or width)
description: The smaller side of image size. This is used for resize and keep aspect ratio in FasterRCNN. If this value is postive,preprocessor will resize the image and keep aspect ratio,such that the smaller side's size is this value. The other side will scale accordingly by aspect ratio. This value has to be a multiple of 16.

comments: Limit of larger side's size of an image when resize and keep aspect ratio
display_name: Limit of larger side's size when resize and keep aspect ratio
description: The maximum size of image's larger side. If after resize and keeping aspect ratio,the larger side is exceeds this limit,the image will be resized such that the larger side's size is this value,and hence the smaller side's size is smaller than output_image_min. This value has to be a multiple of 16.

comments: Flag to enable automatic image scaling
display_name: Flag to enable or disable automatic image scaling
description: If True,automatic image scaling will be enabled. Otherwise,disabled.

comments: Limit of what min dimension you DONT want to train for. Default 10x10
description: The minimum width of the object labels to be considered for training.

comments: Limit of what min dimension you DONT want to train for. Default 10x10
description: The minimum height of the object labels to be considered for training.

comments: 3 channel default
description: The channel depth of the augmentation output. This is the same as the channel depth of the network input. Currently,1-channel input is not recommended for datasets with JPG images. For PNG images,both 3-channel RGB and 1-channel monochrome images are supported.
The right boundary of the crop to be extracted from the original image.
The left boundary of the crop to be extracted from the original image.
The top boundary of the crop to be extracted from the original image.
The bottom boundary of the crop to be extracted from the original image.
The floating point factor to scale the height of the cropped images.
The floating point factor to scale the width of the cropped images.

comments: Enable - go to default,disable - go to 0. Check for the right default values with TAO Toolkit Engg.
description: The probability to flip an input image horizontally.

comments: Enable - go to default,disable - go to 0. Check for the right default values with TAO Toolkit Engg.
description: The probability to flip an input image vertically.

comments: Enable - go to default,disable - go to 1. Check for the right default values with TAO Toolkit Engg.
description: The minimum zoom scale of the input image.

comments: Enable - go to default,disable - go to 1. Check for the right default values with TAO Toolkit Engg.
description: The maximum zoom scale of the input image.

comments: Enable - go to default,disable - go to 0. Check for the right default values with TAO Toolkit Engg which will disable vs enable.
description: The maximum translation to be added across the x axis.

comments: Enable - go to default,disable - go to 0. Check for the right default values with TAO Toolkit Engg.
description: The maximum translation to be added across the y axis.

comments: Enable go tyo default,disable - 0
description: The angle of rotation to be applied to the images and the training labels. The range is defined between [-rotate_rad_max,rotate_rad_max].
The probability of image rotation. The range is [0,1]
The standard devidation value for the color shift.
The maximum rotation angle for the hue rotation matrix.
The maximum shift that changes the saturation. A value of 1.0 means no change in saturation shift.
The slope of the contrast as rotated around the provided center. A value of 0.0 leaves the contrast unchanged.
The center around which the contrast is rotated. Ideally,this is set to half of the maximum pixel value. Since our input images are scaled between 0 and 1.0,you can set this value to 0.5.

comments: Might need different defaults based on task/scenario

description: The architecture of the backbone feature extractor to be used for training.

comments: Confirm correct default values
description: This parameter defines which blocks may be frozen from the instantiated feature extractor template,and is different for different feature extractor templates.

comments: Default values. Verify with TAO Toolkit. 2 sets of defaults required.
description: A flag to determine whether to freeze the Batch Normalization layers in the model during training.

comments: Default values. Verify with TAO Toolkit. 2 sets of defaults required.
description: For templates with shortcut connections,this parameter defines whether or not all shortcuts should be instantiated with 1x1 projection layers,irrespective of whether there is a change in stride across the input and output.

comments: Default values. Verify with TAO Toolkit. 2 sets of defaults required.
description: Choose between using strided convolutions or MaxPooling while downsampling. When True,MaxPooling is used to downsample; however,for the object-detection network,NVIDIA recommends setting this to False and using strided convolutions.

comments: Default values. Verify with TAO Toolkit. 2 sets of defaults required.
description: Probability for drop out
Configuration for input images
The type of images,either RGB or GRAYSCALE
The size of an image's smaller side,should be a multiple of 16. This should be consistent with the size in augmentation_config. This is used when resizing images and keeping aspect ratio
The channel order of images. Should be either "rgb" or "bgr" for RGB images and "l" for GRAYSCALE images
A dict from 'r','g','b' or 'l'(for GRAYSCALE images) to per-channel mean values.
string => one of r,g,b
value in float
A scalar to normalize the images after mean subtraction.
The maximum number of objects in an image. This is used for padding in data loader as different images can have different number of objects in its labels.
The list of anchor sizes(scales).
The list of anchor aspect ratios.
The batch size of ROIs for training the RCNN in the model
The stride of RPN feature map,compared to input resolutions. Currently only 16 is supported.
The rate of DropConnect. This is only useful for EfficientNet backbones.
Type of RPN classification head's activation function. Currently only "sigmoid" is supported.
Whether or not to use bias for convolutional layers
Confiuration fo ROI Pooling layer
Pool size of the ROI Pooling operation.
Whether or not to double the pool size and apply a 2x downsampling after ROI Pooling
Activation function for the model backbone. This is only useful for EfficientNet backbones.
Type of the activation function of backbone.
A dict the maps name of a parameter to its value.

comments: IMPORTANT. Open to user - default should smarty calculate. Check factors that influence.
description: The number of images per batch per GPU.
